Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when, why).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking) verb tenses.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a small red bag rather than a red small bag).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use prepositional phrases.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their).*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use correct capitalization.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Choose punctuation for effect.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when discussing animal preservation).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read accurately unfamiliar multisyllabic words in context and out of context.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details; summarize the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Complexity of Text
Description: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 4–5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as necessary at the high end of the range.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including those that allude to significant characters found in mythology (e.g., Herculean).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, setting descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person narrations.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Complexity of Text
Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in the grades 4–5 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led)with diverse partners on grade 4 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of others.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g., small-group discussion); use formal English when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 4 Language standards 1 and 3 on page 28 for specific expectations.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing.(Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3up to and including grade 4 on page 29.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes and categorize information, and provide a list of sources.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text [e.g., a character’s thoughts, words, or actions].”).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts (e.g., “Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text”).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
